body_html:
@peterjc123
I'm trying to use a PyTorch port of the faster CNN system (see https://github.com/ruotianluo/pytorch-faster-rcnn). It requires building the nms (non-minima suppression) and roipooling module from C code into a python extension. There is a CPU version and a GPU version. I'm currently only using the CPU version. The C file that needs to be compiled includes:
#include <TH/TH.h>
#include <math.h>

I'm not seeing TH.h in the torch distribution, however I do see a THNN.h in torch/lib.
Any guidance on this? Is building python extensions by compiling native code on Windows for your PyTorch port supported?
